Question: Select the department_id column from the departments table and alias it as DeptID.
Select the concatenation of first_name and last_name columns from the employees table and alias it as FullName.

You are tasked with conducting a salary analysis for employees in the company database. Write an SQL query to retrieve distinct job IDs (job_id) and their corresponding salaries (salary) from the employees table. Ensure that the query returns only unique combinations of job IDs and salaries.

You are tasked with generating a report that includes the full name and email address of all employees. Write an SQL query to select the concatenation of first name and last name columns from the employees table and alias it as FullName, along with the email column. Ensure that the query returns only unique combinations of full name and email.

As part of your task, you need to retrieve employee details from the database. Compose an SQL query to select the employee ID, first name, last name, hire date, and salary of employees, ordering the results first by first name in ascending order, and then by last name in descending order.

You are tasked with generating a report that includes the full name and hire date of employees in the company. Write an SQL query to select the concatenation of first name and last name columns from the employees table and alias it as FullName, along with the hire date column. Ensure that the query returns the results ordered by hire date in descending order.

You are tasked with generating a report that includes the top 5 highest-paid employees in the company. Write an SQL query to select the first name, last name, and salary of the top 5 employees based on their salary, ordering the results by salary in descending order.

As part of your task, you need to pinpoint the top 3 most recent hires in the company. Compose an SQL query to retrieve the first name, last name, and hire date of the latest employees, aliasing the hire date column as 'HireDate'. Ensure uniqueness in the combinations of first name, last name, and hire date, and order the results by hire date in descending order.
Retrieve the first 5 employees after skipping the first 5 employees ordered by employee_id.
Retrieve the next 10 employees after the first 20 employees ordered by hire_date.
Retrieve 5 employees starting from the 15th employee when ordered by salary in descending order.

As part of your task, you need to identify employees with salaries greater than $14,000 and retrieve their details. Compose an SQL query to select the employee ID, first name, last name, and salary of employees meeting this criterion, ordering the results by salary in descending order.

You've been assigned to gather employee details from the department with ID 5. Write an SQL query to retrieve the employee ID, first name, last name, and department ID of all employees in this department, sorted alphabetically by first name.
You're tasked with finding all employees with the last name 'Chen'. Write an SQL query to select the employee ID, first name, and last name of employees meeting this criterion.

You're tasked with compiling a list of employees hired on or after January 1, 1999. Write an SQL query to select the employee ID, first name, last name, and hire date of employees meeting this criterion, ordering the results by hire date in descending order.

You've been asked to compile a list of employees hired in the year 1999. Write an SQL query to select the employee ID, first name, last name, and hire date of employees hired in this year, ordering the results by hire date in descending order.
You've been tasked with finding all employees with the last name 'Himuro'. Write an SQL query to select the employee ID, first name, and last name of employees meeting this criterion.

You've been assigned to compile a list of employees who do not belong to the department with ID 8. Write an SQL query to select the employee ID, first name, last name, and department ID of employees meeting this criterion, ordering the results by first name and last name.

You've been tasked with compiling a list of employees who do not belong to departments with IDs 8 or 10. Write an SQL query to select the employee ID, first name, last name, and department ID of employees meeting this criterion, ordering the results by first name and last name.

You've been tasked with identifying employees whose salary is greater than $10,000. Write an SQL query to select the employee ID, first name, last name, and salary of employees meeting this criterion, ordering the results by salary in descending order.

You've been tasked with identifying employees in department 8 whose salary is greater than $10,000. Write an SQL query to select the employee ID, first name, last name, and salary of employees meeting this criterion, ordering the results by salary in descending order.

You're tasked with identifying employees whose salary is less than $10,000. Write an SQL query to select the employee ID, first name, last name, and salary of employees meeting this criterion, ordering the results by salary in descending order.

You're tasked with identifying employees whose salary is $9,000 or higher. Write an SQL query to select the employee ID, first name, last name, and salary of employees meeting this criterion, ordering the results by salary in ascending order.

You're tasked with identifying employees whose salary is between $5,000 and $7,000. Write an SQL query to select the first name, last name, and salary of employees meeting this criterion, ordering the results by salary in ascending order.
You're tasked with identifying employees who were hired between 1997 and 1998 (inclusive). Write an SQL query to select the first name, last name, and hire date of these employees.

You're tasked with identifying the top 5 highest paid employees who are managers and have a valid salary. Write an SQL query to select the employee ID, first name, last name, and salary of managers, ordering the results by salary in descending order and limiting the output to 5 unique records.

You're tasked with identifying employees hired in either 1997 or 1998, ordering the results by first name and last name. Write an SQL query to select the first name, last name, and hire date of these employees.

Write an SQL query to select the first name, last name, and hire date of these employees, aliasing the hire date column as HireDate. Ensure that the query returns only unique combinations of first name, last name, and hire date, and orders the results by hire date in descending order.

You're tasked with identifying employees whose salary falls between $2500 and $2900, ordering the results by salary in descending order. Write an SQL query to select the employee ID, first name, last name, and salary of these employees.

You're tasked with identifying employees hired between January 1, 1999, and December 31, 2000, ordering the results by hire date. Write an SQL query to select the employee ID, first name, last name, and hire date of these employees.

You're tasked with identifying employees who joined the company between 1990 and 1993, ordering the results by hire date. Write an SQL query to select the employee ID, first name, last name, and the year they joined (aliased as 'joined_year') of these employees.

You're tasked with identifying employees whose salary is between $4000 and $5000 and who were hired between 2010 and 2015. Write an SQL query to select the employee ID, first name, last name, and salary of these employees, ordering the results by salary in ascending order.

You're tasked with identifying employees whose job ID is either 1, 2, or 3, and whose salary is between $4000 and $5000. Write an SQL query to select the employee ID, first name, last name, and salary of these employees, ordering the results by salary in ascending order.

You're tasked with identifying employees whose first name ends with 'er'. Write an SQL query to select the employee ID, first name, and last name of these employees.

You're tasked with identifying employees whose first name starts with 'Jo' followed by exactly two characters. Write an SQL query to select the employee ID, first name, and last name of these employees.

You're tasked with identifying employees whose first name contains at least four characters and ends with 'are' followed by exactly one character. Write an SQL query to select the employee ID, first name, and last name of these employees.

Answer: Magdalen Centre, The Oxford Science Park

Answer: Magdalen Centre, The Oxford Science Park

Write a SQL query to retrieve the employee ID, first name, last name, salary, and the salary of the previous employee within the same department. Use the LAG() function to achieve this.

Write a SQL query to retrieve the employee ID, first name, last name, job ID, salary, and the difference in salary with the previous employee in the same job title. Use the LAG() function to calculate the salary difference.

Write a SQL query to retrieve the employee ID, first name, last name, salary, and the salary of the previous employee in the list ordered by salary. If there is no previous employee, display 'No Previous Employee' in the previous_salary column. Use the LAG() function with a default value.

Write a SQL query to retrieve the employee ID, first name, last name, department ID, hire date, and the hire date of the employee hired before the previous one within the same department. Use the LAG() function with an offset of 2.
Write a SQL query to retrieve the employee ID, first name, last name, salary, and the salary of the first employee in the list ordered by employee ID. Use the FIRST_VALUE() function to achieve this.

Write a SQL query to retrieve the employee ID, first name, last name, department ID, salary, and the salary of the first employee within the same department ordered by employee ID. Use the FIRST_VALUE() function to achieve this.

Write a SQL query to retrieve the employee ID, first name, last name, job ID, hire date, and the hire date of the first employee within the same job title. Use the FIRST_VALUE() function to retrieve the earliest hire date within each job.

Write a SQL query to retrieve the employee ID, first name, last name, department ID, salary, and the salary of the first employee within the same department ordered by hire date. Use the FIRST_VALUE() function to achieve this.

Write a SQL query to retrieve the employee ID, first name, last name, salary, and the salary of the first employee within a rolling window of 3 rows ordered by salary. Use the FIRST_VALUE() function with a specified window frame to achieve this.
Write a SQL query to retrieve the employee ID, first name, last name, and the last salary in the list ordered by employee ID. Use the LAST_VALUE() function to achieve this.

Write a SQL query to retrieve the employee ID, first name, last name, department ID, and the last salary within the same department ordered by employee ID. Use the LAST_VALUE() function to achieve this.

Write a SQL query to retrieve the employee ID, first name, last name, salary, and the last salary within a rolling window of 3 rows ordered by salary. Use the LAST_VALUE() function with a specified window frame to achieve this.

Write a SQL query to retrieve the employee ID, first name, last name, department ID, salary, and the last salary within the same department ordered by hire date in descending order. Use the LAST_VALUE() function with a custom ordering to achieve this.

Write a SQL query to retrieve the employee ID, first name, last name, department ID, salary, and the last salary within the same department ordered by hire date in descending order. Use the LAST_VALUE() function with a custom ordering to achieve this.

Write a SQL query to retrieve the employee ID, first name, last name, department ID, job ID, salary, and the last salary within each department and job ID ordered by employee ID. Use the LAST_VALUE() function with multiple partitions to achieve this.
Divide the employees into four groups (quartiles) based on their salary and list their employee ID, first name, last name, salary, and the quartile they belong to.

Divide the employees within each department into three groups (tertiles) based on their hire date and list their employee ID, first name, last name, hire date, department ID, and the tertile they belong to.
Divide the employees within each job title into five groups (quintiles) based on their salary and list their employee ID, first name, last name, salary, job title, and the quintile they belong to.
Divide the employees into four groups (quartiles) based on their salary within each region, and list their employee ID, first name, last name, salary, region name, and the quartile they belong to.

Divide the employees within each department and job title combination into four groups (quartiles) based on their salary, and list their employee ID, first name, last name, salary, department name, job title, and the quartile they belong to.
List the employee ID, first name, last name, salary, and the percentile rank of each employee based on their salary.
List the employee ID, first name, last name, salary, department ID, and the percentile rank of each employee within their department based on their salary.
List the employee ID, first name, last name, hire date, job ID, and the percentile rank of each employee within their job title based on their hire date.

List the employee ID, first name, last name, salary, department name, and the percentile rank of each employee within their department based on their salary, ordered by department name and percentile rank.

List the employee ID, first name, last name, salary, job title, department name, and the percentile rank of each employee within each department and job title combination based on their salary, ordered by department name, job title, and percentile rank.
Create a view named 'employee_details' that lists the employee ID, first name, last name, and email of all employees.
Create a view named 'department_locations' that lists the department name and the city they are located in.
Create a view named 'high_salary_employees' that lists the employee ID, first name, last name, and salary of employees earning more than 5000.
Create a view named 'department_salaries' that lists the department name and the total salary of all employees in each department.
Create a view named 'employee_hierarchy' that lists the employee ID, first name, last name, and manager ID of all employees.
Create a view named 'regional_employees' that lists the region name, country name, and employee's first name and last name.
Create a view named 'employee_department_details' that lists the employee ID, first name, last name, department name, and location city.
Create a view named 'employee_dependents' that lists the employee's first name, last name, and the first name and last name of their dependents.
Create a view named 'manager_employee_count' that lists each manager's ID, first name, last name, and the number of employees they manage.
Create a view named 'department_average_salaries' that lists each department's name and the average salary of its employees.
Create a view named 'department_salary_ranks' that lists the employee ID, first name, last name, salary, department name, and the rank of each employee within their department based on their salary.
Create a view named 'highest_paid_employees' that lists the employee ID, first name, last name, salary, and department name for the top 3 highest-paid employees in each department.
Create a view named 'department_average_salaries' that lists the department name and the average salary of employees in each department, including only those departments with more than 5 employees.

Create a view named 'managers_with_high_avg_salary' that lists the manager ID, first name, last name, and the average salary of their direct reports, including only those managers whose average salary of direct reports is higher than 6000.
Create a view named 'dependent_counts' that lists the employee ID, first name, last name, and the number of dependents for each employee.
Use a CTE to list the employee ID, first name, and last name of all employees.
Use a CTE to list the department name and the city they are located in.
Use a CTE to list the job title and the minimum and maximum salary for each job.
Use a CTE to list the region name and the country name for each country.
Use a CTE to list the employee ID, first name, last name, and the department name for each employee.
Use a CTE to list the employee ID, first name, last name, and the salary of employees earning more than 5000.
Use a CTE to list the department name and the total salary of all employees in each department.
Use a CTE to list the employee ID, first name, last name, and the name of their manager.
Use a CTE to list the employee ID, first name, last name, and the number of dependents they have.
Use a CTE to list the department name and the average salary of employees in each department.
Use a CTE to list the employee ID, first name, last name, salary, and the percentage of the total salary for each employee.
Use a CTE to list the department name, the highest salary in each department, and the employee ID and name of the employee with that highest salary.
Use a CTE to list the employee ID, first name, last name, and the cumulative salary of employees, ordered by their hire date.

Write a SQL query to count the number of countries and employees in each region. Use Common Table Expressions (CTEs) to first count the number of countries per region and then the number of employees per region.
Use a CTE to list the employee ID, first name, last name, and the average salary of employees within the same job title, including only those employees whose salary is above this average.
